AVSEC Order No. 10/2011 
 
Subject:-   
Security measures for Company mail (Comail) and Company 
material (Comat) 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No. 1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of 
Civil Aviation Security for the purpose of securing the aircraft   operations  directs 
that : 
 
(i) 
for the purpose of  this AVSEC Order Comail and Comat are 
defined as  under:- 
 
Comail:   Aircraft operator company mail, shipped within the 
company’s network of stations. 
 
Comat:   Aircraft operator company materials, shipped within 
the company’s network of stations.  
 
(ii) 
following security measures  shall be  applied  by the concerned 
aircraft operator for Comail and Comat:  
(a) 
in buildings where the company mail and Company 
material are prepared, stored and dispatched to ensure that 
no device or weapon, which may be used to commit an act 
of unlawful interference, is introduced into consignments. 
 
(b) 
during the transportation and delivery of company 
mail  and company material to the relevant aircraft to 
ensure that the consignment remains secure. 
Contd. P-2/-
2:
:2: 
 
(iii) 
the concerned aircraft  operator  shall  ensure that all stores loaded 
on aircraft are correctly assigned for that particular flight and have not 
been tampered with. 
 
2. 
The above  order shall be  implemented  with immediate effect. 
  
3. 
Any violation  of this  AVSEC  Order  shall attract  penalty under   section 
11 A of the Aircraft Act, 1934.
